text: Phelpsiella is a group of plants in the family Rapateaceae described as a genus in 1958.Maguire, Bassett. 1958. Memoirs of The New York Botanical Garden 10(1): 28-29 descriptions in Latin, commentary and geographic information in EnglishTropicos, Phelpsiella Maguire The only known species is Phelpsiella ptericaulis, endemic to the Cerro Parú of Amazonas State in southern Venezuela.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesHokche, O., Berry, P.E. & Huber, O. (eds.) (2008). Nuevo Catálogo de la Flora Vascular de Venezuela: 1-859. Fundación Instituto Botánico de Venezuela. ==References== Category:Monotypic Poales genera Category:Rapateaceae Category:Endemic flora of Venezuela
title: Phelpsiella
